title: Mis contraseñas no se sincronizan
content: He estado presentando problemas de sincronización de todas mis contraseñas, a la hora de entrar a un sitio donde tengo que ingresar el usuario y contraseña, no se autocompleta la información, o sea me solicita poner la contraseña en algunas ocasiones y en otras me pide contraseña y usuario/correo, las contraseñas están guardadas, pero no se autocompleta la información, ya restablecí el navegador, ya lo reinicié, me cercioré que en la sincronización estuviera seleccionado las contraseñas pero aún así las contraseñas siguen sin autocompletarse.

title: Firefox Launching as Blank Page
content: I've been a Firefox user for ages but in the last week I haven't been able to use it at all. Every time I launch the desktop browser it gives me a blank page. I can type in addresses but they never take me anywhere. No google. Can't access settings. Nothing. I've tried seemingly everything. Safe mode. Administrator. Deleted everything and installer at least 5 times to try and start from scratch to no avail. Tried Revo. Tried multiple anti-malware cleans. System updates. Tried using older versions of Firefox. Everything short of a factory reset on the whole desktop which I'm really trying to avoid. I've checked every Reddit thread and forum post I could get my hands on and nothing is working. Does anyone know how to get Firefox working again? I've tried other browsers and hate them I would really like to keep using FF if I can. Picture shows what the app has looked like every time I boot it up or try to search anything for the past week.
creator: emikavanagh

title: Trouble setting up Thunderbird on new PC with WIN11
content: Hi, Sadly having big problems transferring Thunderbird onto new WIN11 PC. Been at it for some days now.... The old PC's C drive is now installed on the new PC (as a spare drive) so all the original Thunderbird files are still intact I believe. I have always kept my email files in separate dated folders on the old PC HD and so have about 27Gb of data (965 files in 111 folders) all under AppData/Roaming/Thunderbird/Profiles/xxxxdefault However after installing latest Thunderbird version and trying to substitute the above original profile I find the old stored files are not visible on opening Thunderbird. the software tries to download huge number of files from the server, and there is no Address Book data from previous old PC install. Appreciate all ideas to stop me losing more of my scarce hair :-) Thanks in anticipation. Keith Dekok keithdekok@gmail.com Australia
creator: keithdekok

title: Manage by your organisation???
content:

I don't understand, this is my private computer. How to remove this organisation management???
